result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell D Keegan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitchell D Keegan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mitchell D Keegan was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if Def completes all cond of prob w/ no violations, ATR's or new charges to level of probable cause.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 1/30/15: Def to serve 30 days jail as a condition of probation to be served with huber for treatment only.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Sentencing hearing on December 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Reporter: Ellen Walfoort
  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights signed; Ct accepted plea; sentencing to be set; bail conditions amended

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Paige C.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall reside at W6058 Ron Hill Ln in Monticello, WI.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 15
Final pre-trial on October 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:49
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Paige C.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing (unless the defendant is residing in a residential treatment facility.)
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
